ai.summary: Chesterfield Round Walk is a challenging 73.6 km circular hike in the UK. This hard-distance trek follows a continuous loop through varied countryside, demanding good navigation, stamina, and multi-day planning. Expect long daily distances, diverse terrain, and potential weather changes.
ai.terrain_summary: The route combines quiet lanes, farm tracks, bridleways, moorland, and woodland paths. Expect uneven, stony sections, grassy slopes, several steep ascents and descents, and occasional boggy ground after rain. There are gates and stiles, exposed stretches on higher ground, and some road crossings; navigation skills and map-reading are strongly recommended.
ai.safety_notes: Plan for multi-day hiking with adequate daylight. Carry a current map and compass or GPS, and check weather and daylight hours before setting out. Wear sturdy waterproof boots and dress in layers. Pack sufficient water and high-energy food. Bring a first aid kit, whistle, and emergency blanket. Inform someone of your route and expected return; mobile signal can be limited in remote sections, so be prepared to self-rescue or seek assistance. Stay on rights of way, respect livestock, and take care on road crossings.
recommended_gear: Layered clothing (base layer, mid-layer, and waterproof outer layer)
Headlamp or flashlight with spare batteries
Water bottles or hydration system (2–3 L total)
ai.best_seasons: Best in spring through autumn (roughly May to September) for longer daylight and milder conditions. Winter hiking is possible with proper gear and shorter daily distances, but can be challenging and conditions may close sections of the route.

seo.title: Chesterfield Round Walk: 73.6 km Hard Circular Hike in the UK
seo.meta_description: Explore the Chesterfield Round Walk, a demanding 73.6 km circular trek in the UK. Learn about terrain, safety tips, gear, and the best seasons for this multi-day hike.
